message.content: This question requires knowledge about reusable items. Option (B), a dish towel, is a commonly reusable item that can be washed and used multiple times. Option (A), liquid soap, is not typically reusable as it is used up and needs to be replaced. Option (C), a band-aid, is meant to be used once and then thrown away. Option (D), an apple, is a consumable item and cannot be reused once it has been eaten.

To answer this question, we need to understand the concept of reusability and which item fits that description. 

Option (A), liquid soap, is not reusable. Once the soap is used or poured out, it cannot be used again. 

Option (C), a band-aid, is also not reusable. Band-aids are designed for single-use and are meant to be discarded after being applied once. 

Option (D), an apple, is not reusable either. Once an apple is eaten, the core and stem are the only thing that remains and they cannot be used again. 

Option (B), a dish towel, is the correct answer. A dish towel is designed to be washed and used again multiple times. It is a reusable item that can be used to dry dishes, wipe countertops, or clean up spills.
